title: Clarence F.C.
text:
Clarence Football Club is a former Irish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in the <a href="Belfast">Belfast</a>. It was founded in 1882 and was a founding member of the <a href="Irish%20Football%20League">Irish Football League</a> in <a href="Irish%20League%201890-91">1890</a>. The club resigned at the start of the <a href="Irish%20League%201891-92">1891-92</a> season without playing any matches, having been unable to raise a team for its opening fixture. By the end of the 1891-92 season the club had folded.
The club was associated with the Church of Ireland Young Men's Society (CIYMS), and named after Clarence Place Hall, the then headquarters of CIYMS.
